intro: Dregea macrantha, commonly known as the giant hooded bellflower, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces large, showy, hooded flowers that are typically violet to purple in color. The plant features a robust root system and thick, fleshy stems that help it store water in its native arid environment. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence, which helps reduce water loss. Dregea macrantha is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
